sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"瘦的"之意。
means: lean ： 侧重缺少脂肪。既可能是因病而瘦，也可能因饥饿而消瘦。也指身体消瘦，但肌肉结实，身体健康。
slender ： 指身体细长、体态优美、苗条适中，多用于指女性。
slim ： 指身体的细长，体重轻不着重外形的优美，可用于不同的性别，常用于减轻体重的人。
thin ： 普通用词，指腰细、骨架窄，常因疾病或疲劳而消瘦。

sentence.Network_en: She was thin and spare, with a sharply intelligent face.
sentence.Network_cn: 她又高又瘦，一副精明过人的模样。

sentence.Network_en: He was a tall, thin man with grey hair.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是个瘦高个，头发灰白。

sentence.Network_en: She is too thin. Feed her up a bit.

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)have a wretched or uncomfortable time
used to refer to the state of being invisible or non-existent
jx.jx_cn_mean: 无影无踪，了无踪影；不存在

lj.lj_ly: they seemed to pluck numbers &B{out of thin air}.
lj.lj_ls: 他们似乎在凭空拨弄是非。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to refer to the police, typically in the context of situations of civil unrest
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（多指社会动荡环境下的）警察

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English thynne, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch dun and German dünn, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin tenuis

entry.def: Something that is thin is much narrower than it is long.

example.ex: A thin cable carries the signal to a computer...
example.tran: 一根细电缆将信号传送给一台计算机。

example.ex: James's face was thin, finely boned, and sensitive.
example.tran: 詹姆斯面部瘦削，轮廓分明，容易过敏。

entry.def: A person or animal that is thin has no extra fat on their body .

example.ex: He was a tall, thin man with grey hair...
example.tran: 他是个瘦高个，头发灰白。

example.ex: He is small and very thin and has pale-white skin.
example.tran: 他个头瘦小，肤色苍白。

entry.def: Something such as paper or cloth that is thin is flat and has only a very small distance between its two opposite surfaces.

example.ex: ...a small, blue-bound book printed in fine type on thin paper...
example.tran: 一本用纸轻薄、字体精细的蓝皮小书

example.ex: A thin layer of topsoil was swept away.
example.tran: 薄薄的一层表土被冲走了。

entry.def: Liquids that are thin are weak and watery.

example.ex: The soup was thin and clear, yet mysteriously rich...
example.tran: 汤又稀又清，味道却出奇地浓。

example.ex: They are stirring huge pots of rice and thin vegetable soup over a fire made of charcoal.
example.tran: 他们搅动着架在木炭火堆上的大罐米饭和蔬菜清汤。

entry.def: A crowd or audience that is thin does not have many people in it.

example.ex: The crowd, which had been thin for the first half of the race, had now grown considerably.
example.tran: 比赛前半段观众还稀稀拉拉的，这时明显增多了。

entry.tran: (微笑)冷淡的，牵强的，不幽默的
entry.def: A thin smile is one that is not friendly or humorous.

example.ex: All she could manage was a thin, wan smile.
example.tran: 她极力挤出了一丝勉强的苦笑。

entry.def: Thin clothes are made from light cloth and are not warm to wear.

example.ex: Her gown was thin, and she shivered, partly from cold.
example.tran: 她的礼服很薄，浑身在发抖，一半是冻的。

entry.tran: (论点、解释)浅薄的，不足信的，说服力差的
entry.def: If you describe an argument or explanation as thin, you mean that it is weak and difficult to believe.

example.ex: However, the evidence is thin and, to some extent, ambiguous...
example.tran: 然而，这个证据难以令人信服，而且有点模棱两可。

example.ex: Even if the optimists' theory is true, it still seems a thin argument against reform.
example.tran: 就算乐观主义者的理论是对的，还是不足以阻止改革的进行。

entry.def: A voice or sound that is thin is high-pitched and not very loud.

example.ex: Her thin voice rose high in complaint.
example.tran: 她抱怨时抬高了尖细的嗓音。

entry.def: If someone's hair is described as thin, they do not have a lot of hair.

example.ex: She had pale thin yellow hair she pulled back into a bun.
example.tran: 她把一头稀疏的浅黄色头发向后梳，挽成了个圆髻。

entry.def: When you thin something or when it thins, it becomes less crowded because people or things have been removed from it.

example.ex: It would have been better to have thinned the trees over several winters rather than all at one time...
example.tran: 当初要是分几个冬天疏剪树木，会比一下子疏剪完效果好。

example.ex: By midnight the crowd had thinned.
example.tran: 半夜时分，人群渐渐散去了。

entry.tran: 使（调味汁或液体）变稀薄;使变淡
entry.def: To thin a sauce or liquid means to make it weaker and more watery by adding another liquid to it.

example.ex: It may be necessary to thin the sauce slightly...
example.tran: 可能有必要将酱汁稍稍稀释一下。

example.ex: Aspirin thins the blood, letting it flow more easily through narrowed blood vessels.
example.tran: 阿司匹林可以稀释血液，使其在变窄的血管里更顺畅地流动。

entry.def: If a man's hair is thinning, it has begun to fall out.

example.ex: His hair is thinning and his skin has lost all hint of youth.
example.tran: 他的头发开始脱落，皮肤也老化了。

entry.def: If someone's patience, for example, is wearing thin, they are beginning to become impatient or angry with someone.

example.ex: Parliament has not yet begun to combat the deepening economic crisis, and public patience is wearing thin.
example.tran: 议会还没有着手应对日益严重的经济危机，公众日渐失去了耐心。

means.word_mean: 1. lose thickness; become thin or thinner
3. lessen the strength or flavor of a solution or mixture;
1. of relatively small extent from one surface to the opposite or in cross section;

sentences.sentence: "you can't be too rich or too thin"
"Yon Cassius has a lean and hungry look"-Shakespeare

means.word_mean: 6. relatively thin in consistency or low in density; not viscous;

sentences.sentence: "skimmed milk is much thinner than whole milk"

auth_sentence.content: The caramel will cool quickly and form thin strands.
auth_sentence.res_content: The caramel will cool quickly and form thin strands.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The caramel will cool quickly and form thin strands.

auth_sentence.content: Clues are thin on the ground for this bunch.
auth_sentence.res_content: Clues are thin on the ground for this bunch.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Clues are thin on the ground for this bunch.

auth_sentence.content: The caramel will fall in thin strands and set.
auth_sentence.res_content: The caramel will fall in thin strands and set.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The caramel will fall in thin strands and set.

Sentence.sentence: A mother who is always complaining about being overweight or old sends the message that women are supposed to be thin and young.
But if they are taken regularly, they cause a thinning of the voice muscle.
Why can't the herd be thinned the old-fashioned way?

sentences.en: She should wear a thinner shirt in summer.
sentences.cn: 夏天她应该穿薄一点的衬衫。

means.word_mean: 稀的, 稀疏的, 稀少的

sentences.en: There were two girls there, a fat one and a thin one.
sentences.cn: 那儿有两个姑娘, 一个胖的, 一个瘦的。

means.word_mean: 弱的, 缺乏力量的, 浅薄的, 微弱的, 尖细的, 有气无力的

sentences.en: His excuse for being late was very thin.
sentences.cn: 他迟到的借口是无法使人相信的。

means.word_mean: (使)变稀薄,  使变淡, (使)变稀少,  (使)变稀疏, (使)变细

sentences.en: He thinned the wine by adding water.
sentences.cn: 他往酒里加水把它稀释。

jushi.english: A thin rain began to fall.
jushi.chinese: 开始稀稀落落下起雨来。

jushi.english: You ought to know better than to go out in this cold weather in those thin summer shoes; no wonder your feet got cold!
jushi.chinese: 你应当明白,这么冷的天不应穿夏天的鞋出去,难怪你的脚冻坏了!

jushi.english: Thick liquid pours much more slowly than thin liquid.
jushi.chinese: 稠的液体倒出来比稀的慢。
